author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 1513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1513, 'last_played': 1569073808}
review:
Ludoku is a simple ripoff of Sokoban with a little bit of effort put into it.   Push the "box" around to the target square, but instead of just using your arrow keys you have to pull levers.   Pull the levers in the right sequence and complete the level.

While a little effort was put in, the game is still an extremely simplistic puzzle game.  The game feels like a tablet port.  Resolution is fixed and there's no widescreen support (the game appears pillarboxed).   These technical deficiencies, along with the simplistic sokoban gameplay (which you can get for free in a flash game or in a web browser or mobile) make this impossible to recommend to any PC gamers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198282335679', 'num_games_owned': 5099, 'num_reviews': 878, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1543404332}
review:
雖然畫面不漂亮, 但玩起來意外地不錯的解謎遊戲, 難易度簡單至中等。
目標: 把球移到到目的地。每次移動依靠附近的數字決定, 有少量機關, 不能碰到任何障礙物。製作者有設定最佳移動回數。

- 雖然有Steam介面, 但按F12無反應。
- 沒有成就也沒有卡。

author: {'steamid': '76561198053049955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1505197864}
review: I enjoy this type of puzzle game where you can plan out moves in advance and are trying to find the solution with the least number of moves.  It intrduces new mechanics as you progress to keep things ineteresting.  Most of the puzzles didn't take me that long to figure out, though there were a few that were challenging.  I would love to have an editor to be able to make and share puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1495674725}
review:
Tags: Casual - Object Routes & Flinger
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Just your average tabletgrade puzzler. No resolutions support. Not a ton of other complaints. Decent execution. Outcompeted and unengaging however.

Yet another mobile port puzzle game with no resolution options. This one does not have a grating sound, it has a fair amount of levels. The mechanics are about pulling your play piece left and right across the board using hooks on the side of the board. Each hook has a number written on it to show the number of tiles it will affect the play piece. With the goal of bringing the play piece to a predetermined end goal spot. The 2D fullscreened correctly. Very low entertainment value on its own. Would require a podcast or something to listen to while playing not to get seriously bored. As it stands it does not entertain on its own and is serious competition with free flash games on internet browsers and as such is Steam Library Clutter

author: {'steamid': '76561198164382571', 'num_games_owned': 1104, 'num_reviews': 422, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1475071391}
review:
[b][i]Ludoku[/i][/b] est un puzzle-game très bien pensé, avec des mécaniques nombreuses et variées.

Le but est d'amener une bille jusqu'au puits de lumière qui représente l'arrivée. Au fil des quelque cent niveaux que comporte le jeu, on découvre la richesse de son gameplay. Au départ, il est seulement possible de tirer sur cette bille, qui se déplace alors d'autant de cases qu'indiqué sur le grappin. Attention toutefois, celle-ci se brise au moindre contact ! Et ce ne sont pas les murs, pieux, sens uniques et autres jets de flamme qui manquent.

Viennent ensuite des catapultes qui la projetent par-dessus les obstacles, là aussi d'un nombre défini de cases. Puis des téléporteurs conservant la direction, des grappins pour se déplacer en diagonale, des symboles modifiant sa portée ou sa trajectoire et enfin des pièces augmentant la valeur inscrite sur les différents mécanismes du niveau. Autant de solutions donc, mais aussi d'embûches.

En cas d'échec, il faudra recommencer le niveau depuis le début. Dommage que n'ait pas été intégré de fonction permettant d'annuler l'action précédente... Afin d'obtenir le score parfait, vous devrez atteindre l'arrivée en un minimum de mouvements. A noter qu'on peut parfois récolter des objets faisant décroître ce total. Mais tout est affaire d'optimisation et, dans certains cas, ils ne sont qu'un leurre : le déplacement ne vaut pas toujours le coup !

Les musiques sont sympathiques, mais pas au point d'être inoubliables. L'essentiel étant que [b][i]Ludoku[/i][/b] s'en tire comme un chef en ce qui concerne le gameplay. Le reste (graphismes, histoire) est franchement anecdotique. Je recommande donc sans hésitation aux amateurs du genre, a fortiori vu son prix.

[h1]Verdict : 4/5 - Très bon, une valeur sûre ![/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198141316848', 'num_games_owned': 481, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1443440960}
review:
顔のついたボール？を引っ張ってゴール地点まで運ぶパズルゲーム。
基本操作は数字の書かれたマスをクリックするのみ。
しかしステージ内には多種多様なギミックが配置されており、一方通行、ワープ、ジャンプ、進路変更など後半レベルになるほど移動後の先読みが難しくなってくる。
もし詰んでも即リスタートできるのでとりあえず試しにと軽い気持ちで動かしていける。
ステージ数は100前後あるが、序盤はほぼチュートリアル、悩ましくなってくるのは中盤辺りからなので実質70～80くらいか。
全クリまで約4時間、500円ならまあこれくらい？

author: {'steamid': '76561198007513026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 433, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1437779935}
review:
Fun puzzle game. I'm not usually a fan of this type of puzzle game but thought I would give this one a try.

The difficulty progression in the first few worlds that I have progressed through has been very well done. New concepts are introduced at a steady pace to keep things interesting. I often find the difficulty of this time of game either stays too easy or ramps up to quickly, so far this one is just right.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012363945', 'num_games_owned': 2121, 'num_reviews': 409, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1501009534}
review:
Surprisingly good game. expected nothing but got a nice brain teaser game.

Idea is to get the ludoku ball moved from start to finish in a very small grid with as few moves as possible. first two episodes are for learning ánd casual play but then slowly things get tricky. play areas are small but the amount of moves required to finish is now almost constantly over 20 as you pass ep. 3 and 4.

8.5/10

Good game all round but some cons exist:

- Lack of achievements which is quite big con as perfect solutions sometimes elude you even if you think you got the best solution. i see here great potential for some very interesting achievement hunting. No youtube videos exist so i am genuinely curious on how to perfect certain levels.

- Vertical pull buttons shallow bright blue color should be better highlighted. I play on living room tv and i dont always notice when a vertical button is lit. 

- Gameplay is grid based so its strange that there is no gamepad support. small detail though. works fine as it is too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036196702', 'num_games_owned': 4162, 'num_reviews': 868, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1436222440}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988012862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 326, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1436261015}
review:
First impression: good puzzle game.

The player moves a luchador-mask-like ball around the playing field by pulling it towards the edge of the playing field by a fixed number of steps (sometimes diagonally). Since you must not pull the ball into an obstacle, or end up on a spike trap, this usually leaves you with a limited number of possible moves, setting up the labyrinth structure that's often at the base of these kind of puzzle games. The challenge is to find the correct sequence of moves, and when there is more than one, to find the perfect sequence with the least number of moves.

While the gameplay is original (as far as I know), it's nothing earth-shattering; but then again, the game is fun, cheap (even cheaper on the Indiegala Monday bundle), looks ok at its 1024x768 resolution windowed or fullscreen, has an effective UI that doesn't get in the way, and provides more than 100 levels.

Recommended.
